page.title: 02Landscape of Acklington
page.content:
{Acklington Village}is a small, attractive, stone-built settlement with more trees than houses. It is situated in a rural setting and surrounded by farmland and 7 farms.
On the west side of the village runs the{London to Edinburgh railway}line. Next to the railway station is Acklington{Agricultural Mart}and nearby is the large{"Station Wood".
Two{prisons}are situated (on what once was an airfield) within a mile of the village and there is a housing estate for Officers and their families.
